Is there some constant $C>0$ such that any graph on $n$ vertices with $\geq Cr^2n$ edges contains a subdivision of $K_r$?



A conjecture of Erd\H{o}s, Hajnal, and Mader. Dirac \cite{Di60} proved that every graph on $n$ vertices with at least $2n-2$ edges contains a subdivision of $K_4$, and conjectured that $3n-5$ edges forces a subdivision of $K_5$.

Mader \cite{Ma67} proved that $\geq 2^{\binom{r}{2}}n$ edges suffices.

The answer is yes, proved independently by Koml\'{o}s and Szemer\'{e}di \cite{KoSz96} and Bollob\'{a}s and Thomason \cite{BoTh96}.




References


[BoTh96] Bollob\'{a}s, B\'{e}la and Thomason, Andrew, Highly linked graphs. Combinatorica (1996), 313-320.

[Di60] Dirac, Gabriel Andrew, In abstrakten Graphen vorhandene vollst\"{a}ndige 4-Graphen und ihre Unterteilungen. Math. Nachr. (1960), 61-85.

[KoSz96] Koml\'{o}s, J\'{a}nos and Szemer\'{e}di, Endre, Topological cliques in graphs. {II}. Combin. Probab. Comput. (1996), 79-90.

[Ma67] Mader, W., Homomorphieeigenschaften und mittlere Kantendichte von Graphen. Math. Ann. (1967), 265-268.
